demolition

Class GameObjectManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • demolition.GameObjectManager

  • public class GameObjectManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages all game objects. It handles game object creation and deletion. The class includes various static helper methods for updating, rendering, locating game objects etc.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameObjectManager() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(GameObject gameObject) 
      java.util.List<GameObject> atPos(int gridX, int gridY)
      Returns a list of game objects that is at the given position.
      void clearAll()
      Clears all game objects and pending add/deletion job.
      void del(GameObject gameObject) 
      void drawAll()
      Calls the draw method of all game object sorted first by y position, then by their render layers.
      boolean inField(int gridX, int gridY)
      Checks if a given postion is valid on the game grid.
      void updateAll()
      Checks for object collision, calls both objects' GameObject.onCollide(demolition.GameObject) for every collision.
      void updateGameObjectList()
      Add or remove according to the pending game object lists.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(GameObject gameObject)

      • del

        public void del(GameObject gameObject)

      • clearAll

        public void clearAll()
        Clears all game objects and pending add/deletion job.

      • updateGameObjectList

        public void updateGameObjectList()
        Add or remove according to the pending game object lists.

      • updateAll

        public void updateAll()
        Checks for object collision, calls both objects' GameObject.onCollide(demolition.GameObject) for every collision. The method then calls each game object's GameObject.update() method. Lastly, the method updates the game object list.

      • drawAll

        public void drawAll()
        Calls the draw method of all game object sorted first by y position, then by their render layers.

      • atPos

        public java.util.List<GameObject> atPos(int gridX,
                                        int gridY)
        Returns a list of game objects that is at the given position.
        Parameters:
        gridX - x position on grid
        gridY - y position on grid
        Returns:
        a list of game objects at the given position

      • inField

        public boolean inField(int gridX,
                       int gridY)
        Checks if a given postion is valid on the game grid.
        Parameters:
        gridX - x position on grid
        gridY - y position on grid
        Returns:
        if a given position is valid
